sect2.title: Installation of MPlayer
sect2.para: If you downloaded any proprietary CODECs, extract them at some system-wide location (like /usr/lib/mplayer/codecs) and add --with-codecsdir=[location] option to the configure script.

note.para: The package maintainers recommend building without any optimizations.

sect2.para: Install MPlayer by running the following commands:

userinput.command: ./configure --prefix=/usr --confdir=/etc/mplayer \ --enable-largefiles --enable-shared-pp && make && make install && make -C libavcodec/libpostproc install

sect2.para: You will need codecs.conf only if you want to change its properties, as the main binary contains an internal copy of it:
The GUI version of MPlayer requires a skin. Extract the default one at recommended location:

sect3.title: Installation for DVD playback
sect3.para: Replace [dvd drive] with whatever device is appropriate, for example /dev/hdc. if you don't know which device to choose, type:
It should result in an output like:

screen.userinput: hdc: Pioneer DVD-ROM ATAPIModel DVD-114 0110, ATAPI CD/DVD-ROM drive

sect3.para: If you have SCSI-Emulation activated for the drives, you'll need to get the right SCSI-device. Every CD/DVD-ROM drive is mapped in the same order as in IDE to the devices named /dev/scd0, /dev/scd1 and so on.
